sentences.sContent: Perry would always flatter Mrs. Mitchell by praising her cooking.
sentences.sCn: 佩里常常奉承米切尔太太，称赞她的烹调手艺。

remMethod.val: f ＋ latter(后面的) → 跟在屁股后面拍马屁 → 向…谄媚， 奉承

trans.tranCn: 向…谄媚， 奉承； 使满意， 使感到荣幸； 使显得好看， 使显得突出
trans.tranOther: to praise someone in order to please them or get something from them, even though you do not mean it
